findings.title: Single-key owner creates total compromise risk
findings.description: The wallet is controlled by a single owner address. If this key is compromised (via vanity address weakness, phishing, etc.), all funds are lost. High-value wallets should use multi-sig.
findings.impact: Total fund loss if owner key is compromised.
findings.recommendation: Use multi-sig (Gnosis Safe) for high-value wallets. Never use vanity-generated addresses for critical operations.

findings.title: No timelock on owner operations
findings.description: Owner can withdraw and execute arbitrary calls immediately. No timelock for large operations.
findings.recommendation: Add timelock for large withdrawals to allow detection of compromise.

note: Root cause (vanity key weakness) is off-chain. Smart contract audit can only flag the single-key risk pattern.
